entry.title: Wide Enough to Shield You All
entry.summary:
Author: Lumeleo

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,038Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 53

Summary: Ever since the first Robin was getting chilly in the cold Gotham nights, one of the most important functions of Batman's cape has been shielding his children. As time goes on and the magic of Gotham seeps further into their bones this protection only grows stronger.

entry.title: Shadows of Wayne: A Dark Reflection
entry.summary:
Author: theyfwmotherraven

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,626Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 140

Summary: In a world where Batman is dead, his children carry on the legacy in the shadows. When they kidnap an alternate Bruce Wayne who never donned the cape, they find a man more open, more trusting, and a far better father.Or,But only one chose to love him in the light. The other, consumed by darkness, loved Bruce to the point of madness.The contrast between the two Alfreds was stark. In the dark universe, Alfred's love had become a cage, bond to trap Bruce in a web of obsession and control, after his AUs death. He wouldn't make the same mistake again. None of them would as soon as Bruce was back in their graspOR,Bruce's breath catches as reality sinks in. Someone not only managed to take him down, but they'd also been in his home. With his kids. Fear shoots through him - how long had he been out? What if they'd come downstairs? His protective father instincts flare up despite his pain.Bruce carefully shifts his position, trying to sit up without waking the kids. He needs to assess the situation, find out what happened and who did this. His hand reaches out, fingers brushing against something cold and metallic on the floor. "What the..." He freezes as he sees it - a syringe.

entry.title: Your Beauty Is That of Gentle Winter, My Dearest
entry.summary:
Author: Ocyus_Stuff

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,958Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 238

Summary: She remembers Bruce’s face - haunted and resigned with steel in his eyes. A flicker of Batman in the mild posture of Bruce Wayne. And how Stephanie wanted to give those old bags the verbal beatdown of a lifetime, but Bruce put a hand on her back and steered them away from the crowd. “It’s not worth it,” he said. He barreled on when he saw Stephanie open her mouth, a retort already shaping on the tip of her tongue. “I’m used to it. I don’t want them to drag you into this”. As if they already don’t - Bruce Wayne and all of his charity cases.“You’re so pretty, you know?” she suddenly starts. Bruce slowly blinks, the way he does at the rare instance that something is confusing him and his brain can’t catch up fast enough to come up with a solution. “Come on, Jason. Back me up here”.Jason sighs. “Your so fucking pretty it makes me wanna vomit”. He turns away, hiding his face behind his hand, but she can still spot the hint of redness on the tip of his ears.orAn asshole slutshames Bruce Wayne at a gala, earning Stephnaie's ire. The old man won't do anything about it, but Stephanie will. She'll enhance his beauty, make him beautiful, unattainable - a true prince

entry.title: Operation: Sleep Well, Destroy Better
entry.summary:
Author: Hasunohana

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,558Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 151

Summary: Clark Kent's marriage to Bruce Wayne threw him straight into the chaos of the Batfam—a den of chronic insomnia and neglected self-care. Determined to enforce at least a bare minimum of healthy routine, Clark declared war on sleepless nights and diets of pure black coffee.Some accepted the changes reluctantly. But Tim Drake? Tim was a whole other challenge.After countless failed attempts to convince him to take better care of himself, Clark decided to fight dirty. The offer? 90 days of regulated sleep and less coffee in exchange for a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity—to humiliate Lex Luthor.Now, the looming question: Will Tim hold up his end of the deal, or will his work obsession (and caffeine addiction) sabotage his own revenge?

entry.title: The Hundred Day Curse
entry.summary:
Author: SolaceInSpace

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 115,219Chapters: 30/?Kudos: 2,970

Summary: Gotham was literally cursed but no one believed Bruce. He took it upon himself to fix it and after decades of searching, that solution came to him in the form of a little blue vial. Bruce was to take the curse within himself to temper it into something manageable.He thinks the others would call him stupid and stop him if they knew about this, but (un)fortunately for Bruce, his family hasn't spoken to him for forever. There was no one here to stop him.He downed the liquid and woke up as his nine-year-old self.Ch3 Excerpt:“Mother, do you remember those funny clouds above people’s heads I told you about? Well, I’m doing something about them but the process is very lonely. Or not. I think it’s just me. I’m the problem. I can’t seem to get people to like me enough to stay. I know–-… I’m aware that it’s due to my own shortcomings but sometimes, it feels like even the worst monsters have people that love them and yet I have no one.”Bruce let out a humourless chuckle and rested his forehead on his knees.“I just wish there was someone that cared about me.”
